Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: przyk
Reviews.Content: We spent the week end in Napa wine tasting. The hotel provides a great base. The location is right on the main highway, so it was easy to get started up the Valley and to get to Sonoma. Even though the hotel is on the highway it is separated by a frontage road and the rooms go back away from the highway. We did not hear any street noise. It's only about 5 minutes from downtown Napa. There is a Target store on the other side of the highway that was convenient for bottled water and a few other necessities. As others have written the rooms were exceptionally clean and the staff was helpful. Even a little snafu at check in, they somehow had us with two rooms reserved instead of one, the problem was resolved in a minute. The breakfast in the hotel is very good. it may seem high at $12.95, but that includes coffee, juice and milk, so it's really not so bad. They call it a buffet, but you basically order about anything you want from the waitress and she brings it to you. I had eggs benedict one morning and a crepe the next. You help yourself to drinks, fresh fruit and pastries. It was good to get a big breakfast f=before a day of wine tasting. We also enjoyed the jacuzzi in the evening and the complementary wine tsting aon Friday and Saturday were another bonus. They have lots of coupons for two for one wine tastings, so make sure you ask at the front desk. We got a coupon for the Hess Collection. It's a beautiful drive into the hills close to the hotel. It was definitely one of the highlights for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: EastsideGal_85
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled at how wonderful this Hilton hotel was for our stay in Napa! It has been updated and the rooms are spacious and very lovely with nice decor. The room was clean and the bathroom was huge! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful during out stay - by far some of the best service I have experienced at a hotel. This hotel was priced much lower than others in the area and exceeded by expectations - I would recommend this hotel very highly!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in Napa and enjoyed friendly, helpful staff. Rooms were immaculate and looked redecorated! Bed comfortable. Would recommend without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeM3863
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice people, beautiful area all around, fairly easy to get to, very much the California easy going feel you would think of. Enjoyed the stay a lot. Staff was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Somerenee
Reviews.Content: Everyone here has been outstanding. The rooms far exceeded my expectations and the entire staff is friendly and informative. A++++

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, great location with only a few minuses”
Reviews.Author: Ekob
Reviews.Content: This is your typical Hilton Garden Inn - nice, clean and affordable. The location is great and it is a great place to stay to save money to spend on great wine and good food. We only had two issues - the hallway we had on the 3rd floor smelled like spoiled food and our bed sloped in the middle. Also if you don't like the small hairdryers connected to the wall, then bring your own. The hotel serves breakfast and dinner. We didn't eat dinner there, but breakfast was consistently good. I would recommend going into Yountville for dinner- its a $25 cab ride. Cab service is brutal. Be prepared to wait 45 minutes for a cab. It's horrible. If you want a car service for the day, I highly recommend Napa Valley Tours and Transportation. They will schedule tastings for you as well. Ask for Ace to be your driver. Also the hotel will ship any wine you buy, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not upto typical Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: travelP2P
Reviews.Content: The man who checked us in was not helpful and lazy. If he was new to front desk work, he should have told us and asked us to bare with him as he worked. He did not tell us how to get to the elevator, if there was breakfast, hours of the dinning area, and asked about anything else. I needed a trolley for luggage and I asked where one was. His reply was "it should be by the entrance". Yeah that's where it should be, but it wasn't, why the freak do you think I'm asking you for a trolley. And he then looked away, dude, get out from behind that stupid desk and find the trolley man! I had to talk to the lady, whom I think was the manager or a senior employee. She got it done in a snap. Now that's what I'm talking about. That lady is a keeper! Not like that scared blonde guy. He needs to go. Unforgivably, there is no free breakfast like Bestwestern or Comfort Inn. I recommend ditching Hilton and going to a better priced and service hotel. I'm never going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but one issue”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesRosie
Reviews.Content: This is now the 2nd Hilton Garden Inn we've stayed at and I have to say - everything is good except - could they please put some money into the bedding?? The sheets at both seemed rather polyester/nylon like. The comforter definitely was nylon -- kept slipping. The mattresses are good, everything is clean, staff is friendly and helpful - it's just the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: Dmitryvulkan
Reviews.Content: I was staying for 3 days in Napa and after careful considerations chosen Hilton and do not regret. I was hesitating at some point between Marriott, which is next door to Hilton and when I arrived to Napa the look of Marriott was more like a cheap hotel. So I liked the hotel stay with all standard features in the room: coffee, water, free wireless internet etc. The heater/conditioner in the room is very noise- this is really a downside and when you arrive in your room it is freezing cold - hotel did not keep the vacant rooms warm. I did not like the breakfast - really very basic stuff and omelets that some people here praised. You're actually much better off with Whole Foods (open at 8am) which is just minutes away or Peet"s coffee, which next to Whole Foods which is open from 5-30am - it is important for jet lagged travelers! A nice features are hotel has a small library, so people can borrow the book to read and when you "Like" them at Facebook - you'd be given a bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Silverwoods
Reviews.Content: I stay here very often for business. It's a nice clean hotel, reasonably priced (for Napa) with a decent gym and breakfast service. I definitiely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nenhum_11
Reviews.Content: great hotel, very good breakfast (not included in the rate, however). Easy parking. Close to good wineries. LArge room, clean and confortable. Concierge is efficient and indicates good restaurants nearby. A little bit expensive, but worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Has local flair going beyond your usual HGI”
Reviews.Author: An0nym0us
Reviews.Content: Although a member of a chain, there are touches of wine country class here. Most notable is the breakfast menu: there are 4 crepes, 4 omelettes, 4 sweet dishes including waffles, French toast, and a Nutella crepe. I had a chicken pesto crepe and a Florentine crepe; we also enjoyed an awesome special eggs Benedict with spinach, an apple-pie crepe and a Belgian waffle. Our server, Bethany, deserves kudos for winery suggestions and her pleasant demeanor. The room included local-themed dÃ©cor and a pictorial guide to selected wineries. Altlough we did not indulge, the dinner menu includes a remarkable wine selection. Our only complaint was hearing our neighborsâ€™ TV through the walls; the front desk helped us in dealing with this situation. The front desk folks were always cheery and helpful. Location is in the city of Napa, so a bit of a drive to most wineries, but this was not a problem. Beds and bedding, bath, and heat/AC were excellent. Although close to 101, highway noise was not a problem here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great 1st impression but OK stay”
Reviews.Author: AlohaMermaid
Reviews.Content: Although I had made reservations 6 weeks in advance, upon check in we were told our room preference was not available. Not the greeting we paid for, but the desk clerk said it was because of the great rate we had. Checked back that evening and still nothing available. After considering going to hotel next door, we checked again and were upgraded to a 2 bed suite that was finally open. We had to inquire about services & amenities and were given our free bottle of wine as an afterthought. I think HGI is better for business travelers who appreciate the breakfast buffet and don't notice the lack of gracious service.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Kristen K
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location - it only took me 15 minutes or so to drive to the wineries and restaurants we were visiting and no more than an hour to get to the San Francisco airport. Rates are very reasonable - stay here and save your money for a very nice dinner out in Napa. Good breakfast and even limited dinner with wine and beer are included in the price for week-day stays. Room size is very generous with a full kitchenette, living room and bedroom. Staff was helpful and welcoming and the room was very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and well located”
Reviews.Author: Ticogringo34
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Napa. Great breakfast and located close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Free bottle of RED or White Wine by liking them on Facebook :)”
Reviews.Author: Choosy2011
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inn is a comfortable hotel with a complete kitchenette. They also have a restaurant on site. The duvet was freshly laundry as you can smell the cleanliness in the room. Also, they give you bottled water for being a HH member and you get a free wine, either Red or White wine by liken them on Facebook. It's about 10 minutes away going to the wineries and they have a great location and front desk staff were Very helpful with directions. They can upgrade you if you request before your arrival. Free water, cookies, free bottle of Red or White wine and free wi-fi were a PLUS.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: adc2211
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for 2 nights. The hotel is very close to the highway and is about 10 minutes in the car to all of the great wineries and restaurants in Napa Valley. Upon checking in we received a bottle of wine from the hotel. The reception desk also had delicious cookies in the afternoon and on Friday and Saturday, the hotel hosts a complementary wine and cheese. Thus, although the hotel was a typical Hilton Garden Inn, the wine themed decor and amenities such as the game room with Nintendo Wii and the Library area, made it feel more quaint. The room was large, clean, and very quiet. The outdoor patio area and pool/hot tub was smaller than expected and slightly disappointing. If you are looking for a luxurious and romantic spot surrounded by vineyards, I'd probably stay at a B&B in Rutherford, St. Helena or a similar area, but if you are traveling with friends, are young, or just need a fun and well-priced hub to explore the wine country, this is your spot!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stop in the wine country”
Reviews.Author: mikee47
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the wine trail. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Room was quiet and bed was very comfortable. Amenities were typical for a Hilton property. Lobby fireplace added a cozy feel. We will use this as our hub the next time we go to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “A repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: Cali_transplant_11
Reviews.Content: I have been to this Garden Inn a few times, I tend to stay here because I am a Club Member so I use HHonors points most of the time. It has upgraded in some ways since the first time I stayed there. The bar has a much better beer and wine selection than a typical Garden Inn. I have actually had dinner there and it was good -- I don't often eat dinner in a Garden Inn but some of the dishes are as good as you get in Hiltons. It's really convenient. Easy to get to and a good base for visiting my favorite wineries and shops. On the whole, I think of it as a "Garden Inn Plus" because I think it is better than other Garden Inns. And I am booked to go back there later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Wine Tour Base”
Reviews.Author: maidentheshade
Reviews.Content: Well-situated just north of the town of Napa, at the southern entrance to the Napa Valley winery action. Tucked inconspicuously off Solano Ave, it sits far enough off the highway to spare you any traffic noise. Convenient to a great food market, it has a long flat sidewalk running along it (parallel to Solano which, in turn, runs parallel to Rt. 12) so you can walk or jog. Small fitness room (1 treadmill). Outdoor tiled hot tub and small pool. No room safes. Restaurant serves good omelets to order ($12), french toast, etc. Nothing fancy but it is clean, quiet, with very spacious rooms & comfy beds and small enough to be easy and quick to get from any room to the front door. I would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inns are my default choice for business travel. They are generally newer properties, have nice size rooms, cater to business travelers and have decent prices. This property has all of that but the decent price. The property is located right off of Hwy 29. So it makes a nice base to hit the wineries. It is on the north side of the city of Napa so you are closer to the wineries. The rooms are nice and what you would expect from a HGI. Nothing unusual or worth noting. The price during my stay was very high. In part because I was staying during the busy season. But still, I paid the same for NYC and many 5 star properties. So the price was not a good value. Still, if you are looking for a Hilton property in Napa, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “(Slightly)Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Mnobles
Reviews.Content: Overall: Hotel has a decent location. Staff is friendly and prompt. All requests were met in a timely manner. Check in was easy and fast. Room: The room is average. Bed is a bit firm. The linens are nice. Towels are soft and good sized. Desk, flat screen TV, chair with ottoman, normal room. The walls are very thin. This is the first time we have had issue with this in a hotel and are generally not light sleepers. The hall outside is noisy each morning. Neighbors could be heard talking. Upstairs room walking was loud in mornings getting ready. Internet: free! Easy to connect, reliable. Not much bandwidth as we couldnt use our slingbox but otherwise no issues. Parking: free! No issues. Dining: Hotel restaurant for breakfast was better than normal cereals and bagels. Made to order omelets and pancakes. Didn't try room service nor any other meal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Hilton Garden Inn in Napa”
Reviews.Author: prtravelmadeez
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Napa was wonderful. We enjoyed our stay there from beginning to end. Was only there 3 nights but the hotel is in great shape and the rooms are like suites. The girls (and I say girls as most of the workers seemed young) were all very very nice and extremely friendly. I say that they were young because to me it is hard to find young people being so friendly and willing to help this day in age. The breakfast is not free but well worth the money. It is a cook to order meal and all you can eat - The beds were very comfortable and for me to say that is a lot since I typically don't sleep well unless I am in my Select Comfort bed. We would definately stay at this hotel again if we go back to Napa. It is right off Hwy 29 which is the main Hwy for the vineyards and it about 5/7 minutes from downtown Napa. So very good location. We were with 2 other couples that are use to staying in 5 star hotels and they were very pleased with the Hilton Garden Inn. I would rate this a 4 star - very clean.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Hilton Garden Inns around”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler1217
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Hilton famil hotels, including many Hilton Garden Inns. Honestly, the HGIs usually don't impress me too much, and I hesitated when booking this one. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to find a large, beautiful, clean room and bathroom. This is definitely one of the nicest HGIs I have seen in quite some time. I did not use the fitness center or the restaurant, so I can't comment on those. But, if you are looking for a reasonable, nice hotel in Napa, this is a great one to pick. Ample parking (for free) and close proximity to vineyards, etc, but also close to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable "Launching Spot" for Napa”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect, reasonably priced option for our quick stop in Napa. Arriving mid-day from SF, we were able to hit several of the southern wineries before stopping at the hotel to freshen up for dinner. The hotel was quiet, easy to find, and comfortably appointed. The room was spacious and clean. Front desk was very helpful with directions and travel times. Would stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Napa Getaway”
Reviews.Author: wino44
Reviews.Content: We have been to Napa a zillion times and have tried a lot of the Hotels there. This one is definitely a great value. Maybe doesn't have quite the pomp and polish of the next door Marriott but doesn't have their price tag either. Light years better than the Westin. The location is excellent to get on the main roads in all directions to wineries. The staff can't do enough for you. It is not downtown, but that is a major plus if you have ever been downtown. The breakfast package is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable and clean. Front desk staff went above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: alison303
Reviews.Content: The HGI Napa is not downtown but the front desk calls a great cab service for you that arrives in 10 minutes and it's about a 5 minute drive to downtown Napa (less than $10 fare). The rooms were clean and spacious with the highest ceilings I've ever seen in a hotel. They even had free wifi. The front desk staff was exceptional. We had asked the woman on duty about the tasting rooms one night fairly late and by the next morning she had printed a list out and called them all to confirm the hours for us. The breakfast was standard and convenient if you need to get on your way. And yes, free bottle of cab after we liked them on FB.

Reviews.Title: “Remodel is great, really a well run property”
Reviews.Author: Tcervellone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again after a long absence. Totally remodeled, really cool little value hotel. Fantastic hot breakfast, great meeting rooms, perfect location. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chain hotel in Napa - So glad I could use my points!”
Reviews.Author: 99p38a
Reviews.Content: Had a long weekend, anniversary to celebrate and Hilton points to burn. I was skeptical about staying in a chain hotel in Napa, but I am glad I did. The HGI was a beautiful hotel, friendly desk staff, clean room (couple carpet stains/burns), nice view of mountains. I would highly recommend it. I even was able to have my wife "like" them on facebook for a free bottle of Hilton Wine :) . It was a 7 minute drive to downtown Napa for breakfast and a 5 minute cab ride at the end of the night back from the wine bar! It is right at the beginning of 29, so location is fine. Some little plazas nearby to walk, but we were in and out and didn't explore the area other than drive to breakfast and have our car pick us up and run us around for the day. If you are heading out of Napa and going to Sonoma or San Fran, stop at Fremont Diner in Sonoma (service is the worst, but atmosphere and food are awesome.) Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Best HGI ever”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton diamond member, I stay at a lot of HGI's. This one was definitely a step above the rest. The rooms were uber-clean, with many amenities not found in many HGI rooms (e.g. bathrobes). The breakfast menu was on the best ever with 5 different types of crepes including a fruit and Nutella one. Parking was ample, wireless good and I got a free bottle of wine for friending them on Facebook. Located near (but not walking distance) from a number of stores (including Target, Whole Foods, and Trader Joe's). Easy access to 29 and the Napa Valley. They even have their own spa. I wish all HGI's were like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: californiasunlove
Reviews.Content: Set away from Napa's downtown, nestled among other hotels, the Hilton Garden Inn was in a fairly quiet area. I never had to use my earplugs, which was nice. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom fairly spacious. I always like it when the hotel provides a microwave and fridge, as I do occasionally have leftovers. It also has free wifi, which seems to be offered less and less these days. I really like the shower, the head is very high and had good water pressure. The soap and lotion were nice too. For some reason the toilet paper holder was underneath the sink, so reaching for it was a little difficult. We ordered the AAA summer package with free breakfast, which wasn't super exciting but did offer a lot more choices than some hotels do. There was only one waitress on staff at the time, so she didn't have a whole lot of time to explain the details to us, but this is the gist: you seat yourself, it's basically self-serve, but you can order anything you want from the grill too. If your meal is comped like ours was, just leave the card that the front desk gave you on your table after the meal, or give it to the server if they ask for it. I had the buttermilk pancakes, which were pretty good. This hotel is a little different, but in a good way. It has a rather small business center, but it also has a room with a TV, board games, and lots of books available too. So if you have kids with you that are old enough to look after themselves for a little while, this could be something for them to do rather than be dragged along with the adults watching them drink wine all day. There's also a fitness center tucked into a corner on the first floor, which I actually saw people using, so I assumed it was fairly decent. The area is mostly filled with little boutique B & B's, which aren't really my style. I was a little tempted by the Napa River Inn, but I think given the choice when I come back, the Hilton Garden Inn is a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location not that great”
Reviews.Author: quicktraveler91
Reviews.Content: This was a typical Hilton with a napa twist on the interiors. The rooms and decor were nice. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. The strange item was it was fit in along the thruway between the Marriott and another apartment complex. No views at all. Pool was a very small area facing the parking lot, not good. It was somewhat close to town if you had a car but not walkable, too far away. It would be a value call to stay here, not a romantic napa experience. The other issue noted by others, was that they had a full breakfast if you paid $12 for it. No continental free one like other hotels. Hope this helps your decision process. Would I stay again? Probably not based on the atmosphere and location.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: bohste
Reviews.Content: If you'd rather stay in a chain hotel instead of an unknown B&B, I would strongly suggest this Hilton Garden Inn. It is located just outside of town and it's a great location for getting around the Valley. My wife and I stayed for 5 nights on vacation. The room was immaculate, the service was outstanding at the front desk, in the restaurant and housekeeping. Everyone went out of their way to help. There was plenty of free parking. I should mention that they have expanded and different breakfasts from what most Hilton Gardens offer and they're very, very good. This is a great option if you're coming to California wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Best HGI I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: setiramm
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT surprise. Here for free night on points and was in a central enough location for all the wineries we wanted to visit. Met all my minimum expecations for the HGI brand but what impressed me was the restaurant which had a more extensive breakfast and overall seemed more full service. Great service, beautiful room (106) with all the niceties, safe area and easy access to Napa. This will probably be my go to place for my repeat Napa visits.

Reviews.Title: “On the money”
Reviews.Author: BadgerTraveler45
Reviews.Content: After years of couples-only trips to B&Bs and luxury hotels all over Napa and Sonoma, this was our first family trip (three kids and grandpa) to the valley. For this purpose, the HGI was a good compromise over more expensive properties in St. Helena or Yountville--not spectacular, but solidly comfortable, with pleasant staff and no issues. A good value for the money. Things to be aware of: - It's essentially on the frontage road alongside Highway 29, which makes it convenient, but isolated. Plan on driving, which you probably were anyway. You won't be walking anywhere for dinner unless you like the fish tacos at the (nice) restaurant a couple blocks to the south. Excellent grocery store there, as well as Starbucks, by the way. The Trader Joe's is across the Highway 29 overpass--not a convenient walk. - The pool is postage-stamp-sized, so don't get your kids excited about major splashing. - Bathrooms (especially the tub area) are a bit grotty, but nothing horrible. - Beds in the two-bed rooms are doubles, not queens. - The breakfast pricing is a bit of a mystery--seemed like $11 for the cooked-to-order food versus...$11 for the continental breakfast. Go figure. - No connecting rooms, but the HGI was able to accommodate our request for adjacent rooms. Bottom line, it's comfortable, close enough to Napa Valley destinations, and a good value for what you get. Just don't expect a plush resort...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value - Free WiFi - Good Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: UpscaleButRealistic
Reviews.Content: Home run. Breakfast included cooked egg, or crepe, plus assorted pasterie and fruit buffett, for like $12/pp. WiFi free. Good, but small, gym. Big room. Clean. New. There was a pool and nice little seating area outside. There is no "spa" - but the Marriott next door has one. I did not try.

Reviews.Title: “HGI Rules”
Reviews.Author: mhpra
Reviews.Content: this hotel typical of other HGIs - thanks for that! excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A good and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasretiree
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in the Hilton Garden Inn Napa and can only find good words to describe the stay. Not centrally located, but within a short drive of great restaurants and wineries. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: lkr424
Reviews.Content: It was our annual chick trip and we were going to see wine country! When we arrived at the Hilton I found that I forgot to ask that our two rooms were next to each other. We were late checking in so I thought it would be impossible. The receptionist took her time and found us two rooms right next door. The rooms were very clean and had two double beds. Each morning we got up and ate at the Hilton buffet. It has everything you wanted plus the breakfast crepe made of berries and nutella. The Hilton is right by the highway that takes you through Napa and Sonoma.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: BobAgent21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Memorial Day, place is great and prices are awesome for the value. Rooms are very clean and beds are so nice to sleep in. Room also has a microwave and fridge. Free coffee also available in the lobby. Close to everything. Ample parking!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JayDeeEm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our three day get away to Napa. The hotel was well located and close to a convenient exit off of highway 29. The rooms were new, and well maintained. The staff at the hotel, from the front desk to the restaurant, were incredibly friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking to stay in the Napa area, close to the vineyards and restaurants around Napa and Yountville, and who isn't looking to spend an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place for SUPER QUIET rooms”
Reviews.Author: RobTexas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We couldn't believe how quiet our room was even though we were next to the elevator. Even the air conditioner was about as quiet as one could expect. And we can't say enough about the friendly and extremely helpful staff that made our stay that much more enjoyable. The beds even had adjustable firmness controls as well as one-inch pillow tops on the mattress. The only improvement we could see that was needed was more attention to wiping the water off the floor that was tracked into the hotel from the pool. All in all though, this hotel gets a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “friendly service nice ammenities”
Reviews.Author: miketp
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. they provided maps and suggestions that were very useful, such as using the access road to go north to avoid CA-29 during peak traffic periods. The room was clean and spacious and included free wi-fi, a refrigerator, and a microwave. A USA Today was outside our door every morning. As others have noted the channel selection on the TV is very limited. There is a Safeway and Target on the other side of 29 which made shopping for ice packs and supplies very easy. It is located outside of downtown Napa but is a short 10 minute drive. It is not a cheap Hilton Garden but was to be expected in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Train Delight”
Reviews.Author: Gypseas
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i found an incredible deal for a "couples weekday getaway". For under $500 we have received a 2 night stay in a beautiful king bed delux room. Also included in the price is a lunch and tour on the Wine Train, Passes to 6 local wine tastings, a free bottle of wine, free made to order breakfast for both mornings, and some free waters for your room. One of the BEST package deals I have ever come across. Nights of June 7th & 8th, 2011 The first night we decided to have dinner at the hotel and we were very impressed with the fruit and cheese platter, Margarita Pizza, and bottle of Syrah from local winery. The two servers were very nice and full of Napa information. Breakfast omlettes are incredible, fruits are fresh, but the waffle was so-so... Pretty damn close to perfect for the price....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deezoomo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Hilton Garden Inn and it was great! Very clean. Big room with refrigerator and microwave. We bought the room rate with breakfast included and it was worth every penny. They serve a full breakfast every morning, made to order along with a variety of cold items such as fruit, yogurt and cereal. Crystal at the front desk was extremely nice and helpful. There is a nice pool and hot tub. The hotel is right off Hwy. 29 and not far from shops, wineries and resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: trendytraveler11
Reviews.Content: Will stay again....spaces rooms, great service, fab location. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to impress”
Reviews.Author: goldtown
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Napa and have consistently experienced great customer service, and a restful night's sleep in a quiet, clean, comfortable and very accomodating room. Complimentary wi-fi (thank you very much!), my choice of pillow type, microwave and fridge, excellent mattress - and a newspaper delivered to my door. Basic comforts that mean everything when you're travelling - thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best HGI in America!”
Reviews.Author: mcmullins
Reviews.Content: No kidding, this is the best HGI I have stayed in. We travel 200 nights a year and I wish this hotel was in every city we go to. This is like the Model HIlton Garden Inn. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The meeting space and catering services were excellent. HANDS DOWN BEST BREAKFAST, they go above and beyond the traditional HGI breakfast, with to die for Breakfast Burrito, Crepes, Omlets and Eggs Benedict.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelLosAngels
Reviews.Content: My Husband had a class in Napa and I decided to join him. We are frequent wine country visitors and have stayed at top resorts. The conference was in Napa, so we booked the Hilton Garden Inn. We are Hilton Honors members and have never stayed in a Garden Inn. From the time we checked in, to 3 days later when we checked out, the service was 4 star. The rooms were attractive the beds comfortable. They have a cafe where the breakfast choices were reasonable and tasty. If in the area we will choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, so comfortable. No bed bugs. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: cmscherr
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, nightly free wine tasting in restaurant. Fitness center good mix of aerobic machines (with tvs in each), dumbbells, adjustable benches. Free high speed internet. Rooms are spacious, and beds are amazing, quality desk chairs too. Great location, down the road from a target, whole foods, and trader joes, so you don't have to eat out if you want too. Rooms have a fridge and microwave. ~15 minutes from the valley, right off of highway 29(?) which is the main drag for wineries. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: NancEureka_CA
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room, great price, and excellent friendly staff. Mentioned to a front desk attendant that I had lost an earring down the drain. When I returned to my room that afternoon, maintenance had taken apart the drain, retrieved the earring, cleaned up and left the earring on the counter for me! Staff also took their time with me to help me find the perfect restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Orderly”
Reviews.Author: Vesper-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I do appreciate a good chain hotel like the Hilton, since places like this have standards that you can rely on. A well-appointed room: with attention to details such as the lighting in the bathroom (doesn't cast shadows on your face when you put on your make-up); good writing desk for your laptop with, ergonomic chair and high speed internet access at your fingertips; comfortable bed. Across the highway from this hotel is Whole Foods and a wonderful independent bookstore called Copperfields with a unique toy selection where we bought gifts for our kids. Only disappointment was that breakfast was not included. We asked the front desk twice, and each time, it was "11.95/person." For 269/nt, can't they comp or discount breakfast for Hilton Honors guests?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iamirish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while in Napa. The hotel is close to all the wineries. You do need a car however. Room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff at front were very friendly and helpful. I would not recommend the restaurant in the hotel. We went for dinner on our first night. We waited five minutes before getting a menu and then another five and then left. Only one young man serving. He seems to do everything including delivering room service. He was very pleasant so I do not fault him. He should have had more help. I can see why the restaurant was not busy. Lots of other restaurant choices nearby so we did not try again. The rooms are not very soundproof, I could hear someone coughing very clearly in the room next to us and could hear walking in the room above us. Because of the location and the price we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the typical Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: trcoc
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Hhonors member and travel frequently for business. I make it a point to stay at Hiltons whenever I can because I usually know what to expect and they typically offer a quality product. At this Hilton Garden Inn, I reserved for an upgraded room, with a sitting area and whirlpool tub. No mention was made at check-in of any changes to my reservation . When I got to the room, I found that there was no seating area or whirlpool tub, so I called the front desk. The woman who had checked me in glibly told me that all of the larger rooms had been given out prior to my arrival, and they had downgraded me, but they weren't going to charge me for the larger room. No apology and no attempt to make it right. The other frustration was the air conditioning unit. It was a window unit, typical to what you would find in a Motel 6 or some other cheaper property. It was noisy and woke me up every time it clicked on during the night. So I'm attending my meetings today with very little sleep and a bad taste in my mouth from this experience, I could have spent half the money to stay at a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton Garden Inn off of the highway”
Reviews.Author: Toptraveller4
Reviews.Content: We only had a one night stay in Napa so this suited us just fine. It just off of the St. Helena Highway which takes you to the vineyards. If we had had more time I think we would have liked to stay in Yountville but of course the hotels there would be much more expensive and are in a totaly different category. The Hilton is quite typical, with the covered entrance, restaurant and lobby and seating area when you enter. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Our room had a seating area with pull-out couch when you entered and an open bedroom area by the window with the washroom in the middle. Big enough for the 4 of us. Only complaint is the smell of the room deoderizer lingered in the air and I'm quite sensitive to chemicals and smells in general. Would be nice if they didnt have to use that stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Harzanne
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and clean. Includes a refrigerator and microwave. Staff was helpful and friendly. We booked the Winetrain package and recieved 5 coupons for free tastings at Napa Wineries. We visited all of them and they were the best wineries of all we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrtr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at this hotel, while touring the Napa wine country area. We were very impressed by the quality of the service. Everyone from the front desk personnel to waiters at the restaurant to housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, and pleasant to stay in. The quality of the bed was top-notch, and we enjoyed a very restful good night's sleep. The restaurant food was well-priced, and of good quality, too - and came with good service. We look forward to returning to this hotel again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, pleasently suprised by...”
Reviews.Author: NettytheKat
Reviews.Content: Great staff, pleasently suprised by quality of room. Bed one of best hotel ones have slept in. Shower good. Only surprise was not being able to get drink and good in afternoon apart from delivery. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for the second time, will return again.”
Reviews.Author: mbob
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the HGI. First time due to last minute booking, I got a room near the ground floor elevator and front lobby - extremely noisy. The room itself was comfortable and large. The second time around, I stayed in a room with a whirlpool and king size bed - once again the room was extremely spacious and I did get an excellent night sleep as it was the room in the corner. Views from the hotel are nothing special - even the second floor room looked over a high school playground and the mountains in a distance. There is a wine hour every afternoon and they have fruit and cookies at the front desk - not sure what time they put them out. Did not try the restaurant. The hotel is very close to shopping - Whole Foods, Target etc. The staff is excellent and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in this hotel and choosed it because of its situation and as I'm HHonors member. Booked in adavance and had a reasonable price for the aera but still quite high I think. King bedded Evolution room 231 was given to us and it was very large with 2 flat screen TV's, a sofa and fridge. Free wi-fi was available as well as 2 bottled Water. Nice touch after a long drive. Location is out of the centre of Napa but still ok to drive. If you go North, you'll find all the Wineries. Going South, check the Outlet stores for some shopping. Check-in and check out was good, breakfast choice and quality was nice but the waitress was a little "stressed".

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Pamahler
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from our first trip to Napa Valley. We found the Hilton Garden inn to be a great place to stay. Staff was very helpful. Lobby area was lovely for relaxing and having coffee and cookies which are provided all day. Breakfast was excellent and if you friend the hotel on Facebook you receive a free breakfast. Our room was comfortable and quiet. Nice pool area and hot tub. We did the Wine Train package with tasting at six wineries. Great place and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great wine package, nice people, comfortable and modern rooms!”
Reviews.Author: meganjo
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn had a great package we booked which included a Wine Train adventure (LOVED it - great food and a really unique and good time!), a wine pass to 6 different wineries (some of which hasd tasting fees of $20 per person which we got for FREE with the pass). For our short Napa trip, we couldn't have done much better. Call them to book - their website doesn't book it properly. The people working at the desk were very friendly - always greeting us with a hello and were helpful for getting around. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and modern (flat screen with included HBO). Our room was beautiful and spacious (as well as a spacious bathroom). Free USA Today in the morning. Free fruit and coffee in the lobby. If you become a Facebook fan you get a free breakfast coupon (they have a yummy breakfast that cost about $12). On the weekends they have an in-house tasting, but we were there mid-week. The one detractor is that they are not within walking distance of any wine bars/tasting rooms and they don't have a shuttle downtown either. We knew before we booked and were expecting it, but just one small complaint. As far as recommended wineries, we loved them all :-) Here is what we visited and what I remember of cost etc.: --Black Stallion (hotel wine pass ~$10/person without) They had a lovely wine bar but were building an outdoor area that will be really beautiful when it's finished! --Van den ?Heuval? (hotel wine pass ~$5/person without) Very small, not a very nice tasting area but made up for it in personal attention and delicious wine. Known for their late harvest wines. --Gustavo Thrace tasting room downtown Napa -free- must watch the movie Bottle Shock before you visit Napa -- the man behind Gustavo Thrace is in it - fun! --Uncorked Napa downtown tasting room - free with printable online coupon - yummy and fun. --Wine Train to Grgich - Wonderful experience. Gourmet meal on the way up. Nice tour and tasting. They gave us each a memento wine glass as well. On the way back down we sat in the dessert car (both delicious and beautiful). --Mumm Napa - (~$15/person) Beautiful sitting area to taste their sparkling wines (and another sitting area to taste their more expensive ones as well). They have an online coupon to print off before you go on their website. V. Sattui - they have a museum and picnic area for items purchased there, we didn't get a chance to taste because we got there too late :-( Alpha and Omega - (hotel wine pass - $20/person without) - Beautiful vineyard and tasting room That's all we had time for in a day and a half since most wineries seem to close at 5. Oenotri is a fun Italian restaurant downtown where we had Salumi (salami tasting plate) which was a new experience for us (and also delicious). We want to go back already!

Reviews.Title: “Is just fine if you are too late for a B & B Napa, Sonoma reservation”
Reviews.Author: denver6
Reviews.Content: Works fine if B & B reservations are all full. We like B & B's, but many months in advance they were all full. This Hilton Garden Inn was just fine. Beds were comfortable, it was quiet, there was a frig for white wine bought at the tastings, pool was nice at the end of the day. One outside table near the pool for take out dinner, was full the first night we were there, so didn't plan on it the second night. Wine tasting at hotel is too early for guests who are still out and about. We got back about 6 pm and it was closing early--the winery tastings have more ambiance. There is a grocery store/take out place, easy driving distance about 6 blocks south of the hotel, just south of the Starbucks (can't remember name of store). Great food, coffee, wine selection. Trader Joe's, Whole Foods across the highway.--have to drive there. Walked to the Marriott for dinner, was just mediocre. The Silverado Highway drive out of Napa is very nice. Ox-Bow market area was nice, free parking. Only takes an hour or so to visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calif0rniadreamers
Reviews.Content: Because of previous positive reviews for this hotel on TripAdvisor, we stayed here. We found the staff very personable, the room spacious and clean, and the breakfast personnel welcoming. We have stayed at other hotels in the Napa area where the rooms were so dingy that we didn't even want to look. This hotel, however, had very nice furniture, a very comfortable bed with plenty of pillows to choose from, and a nice bathroom. The only minor flaw was that the air-conditioning fan was a bit too loud, and there was no way to turn it down (It was either "on" or "off" with no way to moderate the noise), so we slept without a/c since the weather was fairly cool anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Cool-son
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. We booked the hotel and wine train as a package and were not disappointed. Rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable. We were able to get a free breakfast by joining their group on Facebook. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Only downside is that it was a little further from downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Canada_girl28
Reviews.Content: - Great breakfast- (get one free if you become a Facebook fan of the hotel!) - Great shower head (pressure, spray) - Good water temp in shower - Curved shower rod for extra arm room - Clean room and bathroom - Pack n play for our infant- a bit old/ used looking but satisfactory - Good rate and good proximity to wineries - Free wireless internet included - Excellent mattress - Excellent parking - Helpful staff at front desk when we asked for winery recommendations Overall we were very pleased with our stay in this hotel. The bed had a fantastic mattress and both my husband and I slept comfortably. We did not use the pool since it was outdoor and the weather was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Clean room, A Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: eam1022
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Napa mostly because of the affordable price, but were highly impressed with the friendly staff, hotel cleanliness and yummy breakfast. The manager, Bunny, made sure all our needs were met and provided us with many coupons for restaurants and wineries in the area. There is a little bit of a drive to some of the main wineries on 29 and the Silverado Trail, but over all the location is great, since its right of highway 29. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Francee8
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The staff was friendly, it was clean and the room so comfortable. It is situated within walking distance from shops and close to the designer factory outlets. The chef was very accommodating to my diet and every morning prepared my special breakfast. Internet is provided free and so is parking. I really felt at home and was disappointed when we left. I would definitely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Price, Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: rtd3_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGI for our wine tour weekend. The hotel is your typical HGI. Very clean, roomy and pleasant. We choose to stay here due to the price compared to other B&B and Hotels. The location is about 7 miles to Oakville wineries and about 2 miles from downtown Napa. They did not have a shuttle, but we had a rental car so we could get around. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again. They do have a bar that opens at 5PM. There is a breakfast area where you can get a hot breakfast for $13.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location for Birthday Weekend in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Barlow65
Reviews.Content: For my fiancee's birthday, we made the trip to Napa with her college best friend and her husband and were lucky enough to find the Hilton Garden Inn. We spent all day wine tasting at wineries located with a few minute drive up Highway 29 and followed up with a great dinner at Compadre's in downtown Napa which was also a few minutes away. The hotel made a perfect spot to retire back to at the end of the night and served a great full breakfast, which was perfect to wake up to the following morning before a little more wine tasting on the the way out of town. Next time we come to Napa we will stay at the hotel again as it is so centrally located and close to the wineries on Highway 29.

Reviews.Title: “PAY ATTENTION - Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Mdparrish1
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond Memeber, which means I always stay at Hilton Properties and I have a foundness of them. This management team are the sneakest bunch I have run into in a long time. I reserved a room with 2 beds while traveling with friends to Napa on our way to Tahoe. When I got there, they swore that I didn't have the reservation and that I would need two rooms. Instant double our price. Then to make matters worse, I called the front desk for a toothbrush because I had left mine in the car. They wanted to CHARGE $5 bucks for a toothbrush. Every other Hilton property in the US provides that stuff for free, along with shaving cream, razors or anything else you may have forgotten. Management (no lie - Her name was BUNNY) was rude and no help at all. The walls are thin, so if your neighbors had too much wine you will hear every word. I won't be going back here again. There was a Marriott right next door that will get my business next time. If you look through the reviews you can tell by the volume of complaints and what REAL customers are writing that this place is a sham! I suggest taking your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: cscaccio
Reviews.Content: We had moved here from a sub-par hotel and only paid $17 more for this room. What a difference! Gorgeous lobby with fireplace, bar, restaurant, snack bar, free coffee, tea, cookies, fruit. Fully stocked game room and library. Laundy, fitness center, free wi-fi. Room was lovely and comfortable with an adjustable air mattress. Service was great all-around. I cannot say enough about this chain - we are staying here wherever we go!

Reviews.Title: “really good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: bonsai35
Reviews.Content: the rooms are really nice and spacious. the staff is friendly. this hotel is a great deal for Napa. the location is not amazing. you cant really walk anywhere, but other than that, this place is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Catera
Reviews.Content: Front desk very helpfull, whole property was very clean, room (106)had fridge, microwave, free wireless, flat screen with HBO. Room service-evening only. Menu could use more choices. Nice wine selection at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - - good value”
Reviews.Author: WileyPost
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the hotel during midweek. I got the room for $119 per night. The check-in was flawless. They made suggestions for restaurants and even gave a card to get a free appetizer at Fume Bistro nearby. Our mainfloor room had very high ceilings and the room was very clean. The toilet broke, but maintenance fixed it within 15 minutes. Didn't hear any road noise or other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet and a good base to go visit the vineyards...”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in summer 2009 on our way crossing the US. We've been in Napa Valley before, but this time we chose this place. We did compare prices and other impressions around this area. The Garden Inn convinced us the most. Check-In was fast and friendly. The Hotel has a nice lobby with a small restaurant and a large sitting area. There's also some chairs outside in the garden to enjoy some food or wine. The Hotel and the rooms are spotless clean. It is located not far from the main road, but not exactly right by it. So it was nice and quiet. And because of being close to the Hwy you'll get to any vineyard pretty fast. Oakville is around 15 minutes away and St. Helena around 30 minutes. This place is a really good base to travel to vineyards. The rooms had a good size and the beds were really comfy. You'll have a good sleep here...There was also a table with chairs and a nice, comfy TV chair in the room. Also the bathroom was really clean...bit small, but nice. All in all we really enjoyed our stay here in both Napa Valley and the Hilton Garden Inn. We sure would come back here again. On a weekday we paid around 180$ a night (plus tax). Which might not be cheap, but considering the location and value it was fair enough. Wanna know more about my trips? Click on my profile or visit: route66traveler.jimdo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetGal22
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I visited Napa for the Labor Day weekend. The hotel is situated in a very good location, good starting point for visiting the wineries. We rented a car and drove to different wineries and just tour at our own pace- good idea. The hotel was very clean, enough space for the both of us. However the bed was very firm, we woke up with back aches :( other than that everything else was great. The staff was very friendly and they even gave us 1/2 off coupons for wine tastings. The breakfast was fabulous- a great way to start every morning!! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller111
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hilton Garden Inn at Napa. The room was nicely fitted out, the staff were very friendly and it was well located to enjoy the restaurants and wineries in Napa. We had a room on the ground floor which had very high ceilings. There was also complimentary internet access with printers for guests which was a nice surprise - and well used!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: KevinOB
Reviews.Content: Quality hotel as one would expect from Hilton. Staff really went out of there way to arrange a late winery tour for us. Recommended Holme Grown which is a new tour company. Took the four of us in a new Mercedes on a private showing of 5 wineries for $85 including lunch, about 5-6 hours. Tour guy was awesome, would use him over the 'big box' companies. Hotel had local wineries on hand from 5-7 tasting their wines. Walked to a few places for dinner, had to cross major road but no worries. Good value and staff gave us some 2 for 1 winery tastings. Skip the well known wineries and tour the smaller ones, the gave us more personal attention and details. Skipped the breakfast and took a few bananas and apples for breakfast. Great front office folks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Food, friendly, helpful service, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: lindaw11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the price...the room was recently re-furbished, the breakfast in the morning was excellent, the service from everyone was also excellent. The room was lovely and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business in town”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near highway 29, easy access, not far from downtown and the wineries. Rooms were spacious, staff attentive. Small excercise room. Check out downtown Joe's for great food and beer selection.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jacksonsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wine weekend. Everyone else stayed at the Marriott, but we were a little late in making our reservations. We loved the hotel. The rooms were very nice and seemed to be recently updated. The breakfast was fantastic!! The work out room is small, but the equipment was extremely nice. The front desk staff was fantastic. I am a hotel manager and wanted to sneak them into my suitcase and bring them home with me. I thought the hotel was a great value and am shocked to read otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: JCarlson1
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website are very deceiving; It is overpriced and average at best. It was clean, the staff was very helpful, but that's about it. It is overpriced, and you are going to spend alot of money in Napa anyways, so you might as well stay at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: djmlas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our first trip to Napa in October of 2008. We will stay here again when we return. Check the online rate and call them to get a better rate. We saved $20 per night by doing this. Rooms are newly renovated and nicely decorated. Beds are very comfortable. Some rooms have flat screen TV's. The staff is very friendly and informative. It is near many quality restaraunts and fast food, shops (Target, Whole Foods, World Maket, Outlet Mall), and wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience for Napa”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night as I was traveling through to Northern California following a long flight from Europe. Rooms are comfortable - free wireless internet access was a great bonus. Nearby there was good shopping malls and restaurants to eat at. Hotel is nothing special but does what you want- i.e. comfortable bed , great LG TV and good internet access also located conveniently to highway.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel and great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: uktravellerBeds
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here over labour day weekend and have nothing to complain about. Check in was great with details pre printed so very fast. Our room was clean, very tidy and the pictures are a bit like something from Rooms to Go but not offensive. It is a good base for visiting the wineries being just off of the 29. What we found to be gem was the restuarant, newly taken over some weeks ago it offered great food well presented and cooked, not the simple fare that was previously offered. Daily specials were amazing and Matthew who was there to look after us was great and knowledgeable. Breakfast was also good, although we booked an inclusive rate full cooked buffet was $9.95 and continental $4.95. If only all hotel restaurants were as good

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLawyerNYC
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel when a few rooms suddenly became available about a week before our arrival, on a weekend where it seemed like most hotels were sold out and the rest were on "Special Event Rates" (i.e. higher than the maximum Rack rate). Hotwire had nothing in Napa proper except the Vino Bello, which we didn't want and weren't going to pay $300+ a night for. Priceline had nothing except what was probably the Vino Bello at a $264/night counteroffer (meaning availability at about $239). The Marriott next door was almost $300/night at the Marriott site, and, in the end, wouldn't have been worth an extra $100/night. In short, rooms were tight, so we went with this, eyes-wide-open, knowing we weren't going to get some kind of Four Seasons Spa experience, but were hoping to get a decent place to stay in a good location. We knew that HGI was Hilton's answer to Courtyard by Marriott; personally I find it a brighter, friendlier version of that chain, with a nice color scheme and furnishings and very professional management. What we wanted was exactly what the Hilton Garden Inn ("HGI") provided: a modern, exquisitely-clean, quality hotel with a location near the highway in the city of Napa. We didn't need a super-fancy room or traditional "resort" amenities, because we planned to spend our time at the wineries and at great restaurants in the area, not in a pool or sunning ourselves or eating room service. We didn't want a musty bed-and-breakfast, or someplace (like Vino Bello) with (rumoured) super-thin walls. For $209/night, the HGI fit the bill more than we ever expected, and was still way cheaper than what was available in Napa that weekend. Room: Impeccably-clean. Recently-updated with the HGI signature interior, including the signature work chair (and nice big desk), allergen-free pillows, and firmness-adjustable mattress. (It still had that "new room smell", in a good way.) Free high-speed Wireless internet throughout the rooms and public spaces (with wired conx in the room if you still want to use your blue cable or don't [gasp!] have Wi-Fi), print documents to business center, great shower head and shower-curtain that is see-through from shoulders-up, unstoppable hot water in the morning, microwave, fridge, coffeemaker with decent coffee, iron and ironing board in closet, weekday laundry and dry-cleaning service, typical Lodgenet tube TV. As with all HGIs, there's a 24-hour "pantry" next to the front desk with the usual stuff-you-left-at-home-dang-it, as well as bottles of coke for $1, zone bars, and frozen items you can cook in your microwave, like Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets, Burritos, etc. (Trader Joes nearby also has good stuff you can microwave.) They don't kill you on the prices of this stuff, which I appreciated. I have seen a few reviews that say that the mattress is very firm. Well, yeah, if you don't adjust it. The adjustment knob is on the side of the bed by each person's head, which allows you to make it as firm or as soft as you wish, within reason. How to use it (as well as how to adjust the signature work chair) is in the "In-Room Comfort Guide" that one finds on any HGI pillow, but many folks probably don't read. Did I say the room was clean? Wow, was it ever! Also, most evenings, there's a big basket of free cookies at the front desk, just baked by the restaurant staff. Staff: Despite old reviews on here to the contrary, we found the staff -- and I mean every single person -- to be what Hilton calls "genuine" and friendly. Down-to-earth friendly. "How's my favorite couple?"-friendly. They must have either replaced or retrained the front desk staff from the early bad reviews, because they all went out of their way to be friendly, fun and helpful. When the restaurant was closed before we arrived one night, the Chef (in his chef's coat) gave us a number of great suggestions where to go (the Red Hen Mexican place on the same service road a few blocks North is GREAT!). When we checked in just after noon, they found us a nice room in a quiet wing, and as we were walking to our room, we passed numerous housekeeping people, all of whom made a point of looking us in the eye, smiling, and welcoming us. That's just plain good training and nice people. Location: The HGI is located right next door to the Napa Marriott, and right on the service road for the main highway from the city of Napa into the vineyards. If you stay South of Napa (like at the Vino Bello or further south at the Fairfield Inn by Sea World), you add a good 20 minutes in each direction to your trip North of the city of Napa into the countryside with the vineyards, which would be a drag. If you stay deeper in the city of Napa, you have to fight through a lot of lights to get back to the main highway to the vineyards. At the HGI, it's get up, get in car, go to vineyards. The hotel is about a 15 minute cab ride (or car ride, but we didn't want to drink and drive) to the Wine Train in the center of Napa, with all the traffic lights. We went to the Wine Train by Hopper, which is like a powered Rickshaw (or Tuk-Tuk as you may have seen it referred to in books or movies). Hotel recommended it and made the call to them for us; they showed up right away, and it was fun and quick. They were waiting for us at the Wine Train when it got back. Different driver. Equivalently-super-friendly. In short, we found the location to be just completely optimal for what we wanted to do. Here's a note on location. None of the major chains or resorts really offer what most people think they're gonna get in a romantic wine-country vacation: a location where you step out of bed, walk on your room terrace, and look at the beautiful vineyard just steps away, surrounded solely by beautiful mountains and grapes. The development regulations appear not to permit it. Even the Auberge du Soleil, where we enjoyed dinner one night, really doesn't fit this bill. You can pay $1500 a room night there and still get only to look down into the valley. The Renaissance is in the middle of town in Sonoma. The new Westin will be downtown Napa. The Marriott is on the highway (and nice but not as modern as the HGI). The Sheraton is in Petaluma, a good 35+-minute drive from Napa (and even more from the Napa Valley vineyards), and the Hyatt and Doubletree are more in Santa Rosa, which is a nice area but much more built up and almost an hour from Napa. The love-it-or-hate-it Vino Bello is South of town in a new-ish development of office buildings and that resort; the office buildings don't predominate, but are a little off-putting. That said, Vino Bello really is the only place that actually feels like it's out in the Vineyards (even if that feeling disappears when you look over at the office park). We went to a place called St Francis Winery north of Sonoma, which actually offers dining and tasting in the kind of new, modern, Mission-inspired-architecture, clean facility that still lets you take-off-your-shoes, walk out on the manicured grass and right into the vines in the shadow of the mountain kind of environment that one could wish a resort would do, but doesn't. (If St. Francis could add rooms, which they can't, they'd be mobbed given their picture-postcard setting. As it is, they do dining, tastings and lotsa picture-perfect weddings.) Given that such a resort really doesn't exist here, particularly for $200/night, we were delighted to have a clean, quiet, modern, friendly place to come back to after a day in the vines and tasting rooms. Price: Napa isn't cheap. Yes, some HGIs in other places that aren't Napa offer the same type of accommodation for less money. But they aren't in Napa. Napa is expensive. Don't like it? Stay in Santa Rosa, which isn't Napa but where you can get a Priceline name-your-own-price rate at many of the best chain hotels for $75/night or less (see biddingfortravel.com or betterbidding.com for more details). But if you're staying in Napa, it really isn't fair to say that this HGI is overpriced. It's really a great deal compared to its competition on busy weekends. And that's the only fair way to evaluate it. You're not going to be "pampered" here, but you will be taken care of in a genuine, friendly, professional manner. Food: Didn't have dinner here, but breakfast was very good. For the HGI price of $10/person, maybe you can get breakfast somewhere else cheaper. (There's a Jack in the Box across from the shopping center with Target, Trader Joes, etc., for example.) But for a no-nonsense hot breakfast with omelets made-to-order, Starbucks-coffee, nice assortment of breakfast meats, breakfast fruits, cereals, pastries, etc., where you can seat yourself and be done in 20 minutes no problem if you're in a hurry, the HGI facility ROCKS! The waiter couldn't have been more energetic or friendly, busting his butt to provide a sense of caring and service and to cash out folks super-fast if they needed to go, but not rushing them if they wanted to linger. When he brought us water, my g/f apologized for rushing him because we were in a hurry. He actually said, "Don't apologize, that's what I'm here for. I'm happy to help." Pinch me. I'm clearly in Oz. The restaurant is clean, bright, friendly, and has very good-quality food. I think the continental breakfast is cheaper, and HGI also has a room rate that's $10/night higher that gives you breakfast for up to 4 people in the room (i.e. as cheap as $2.50/person). If we had known how much we would like the breakfast, we would have done that, because we ended up eating in the restaurant every morning. I noticed that a fair number of people were using the evening room service, which has (to my mind) fairly-decently-priced American favorites, like steak, burgers, etc. The plates on the trays outside the rooms looked licked-clean, so I guess dinner must be as good as breakfast. There's also a bound album on the coffee table in the lobby that contains photos and menus from many of the area's better restaurants, so you can see for yourself where you might like to eat in town. Guest Profile: This seemed to be a mix of 30s, 40s, 50s and 60s, mostly without kids. Mostly couples and groups of business-guys or vacationing-guys. Mostly mature and well-behaved. Didn't notice any screaming, running, trampling or otherwise-intrusive kids (or adults). Overview: A clean, comfortable, modern, 3-story hotel, right off the main highway in the city of Napa, with digital-thermostat-controlled individual-room heat/cool units that are powerful enough to chill the room down on a hot day within minutes, plenty of free parking, a friendly-and-attentive staff, a great shower and good amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel, don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: runner40
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and my daughter for one weekend. It was a complete disaster. The staff was very unfriendly. I think we ended up paying over $200 a night. I knew right away, that our stay wasn't going to be a pleasant one. The room was small, dark and there was this tacky painting on the wall. The bathtub looked liked it hadn't been cleaned. That was pretty disgusting. I would never stay at this hotel again. One more thing, I complained when we arrived home to the "corporate offices." For weeks no one responded, then finally, after over one month, I received a generic e-mail from them. HORRIBLE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute small hotel would go back”
Reviews.Author: jy99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Napa for a 3 day trip and booked the Hilton Garden Inn. It's not like your regular Hilton hotels - as the name suggests it was more an Inn if anything. We are both in our late 20s, but found the crowd to be older at this hotel - more older tour groups and families. The room was very clean and a good size. We had the breakfast buffet downstairs and it was good and the price was OK. The front desk staff were really helpful - they gave us a suggestion for an outdoor festival which was great. Also gave us a taxi cab number we could call since we didn't always want to drive every night. The pool was really small - more for little kids to play in with their parents. But then again we weren't going for the sun/pool, so can't really complain too much about that.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PinotNoir25
Reviews.Content: I found the hilton to be very clean and new. It has every amenity a traveler could want and it is very conveniently located near the highway and a shopping plaza. I did not like the break fast fee ($10 per person for a box of cereal) I found the WholeFoods down the street to be cheaper and healthier for breakfast. The price was affordable and the staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: kellielc7
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, staff, rooms, cleanliness, hotel! Absolutely recommend and plan on revisiting!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: naiad51
Reviews.Content: My mother & I were visiting the Napa area from the east coast to celebrate her 90th birthday. Also meeting us at the HGI were relatives from other parts of the country. We made our reservation directly w/the hotel. They explained about the B&B option which provided a full breakfast for less than the cost if you purchased the breakfast at the hotel restaurant. If you do not use the B&B option I think the breakfast is overpriced, but it is convenient. The service provided by ALL the staff was outstanding during our entire 4 night stay. When we arrived they asked if they could help with our luggage! And when they found out it was Mom's 90th birthday we were celebrating they brought complimentary wine to the room! Our room was the typical HGI room-2 queen beds, flat screen TV, microwave, refrig, coffee maker, hairdryer, etc. The room was very clean and looked brand new. Some of our group rented suites and these rooms provided a somewhat separate living area with a sleep sofa. Good choice for a family of 4 or more. On most nights there were complimentary wine tastings w/cheeses in the lobby. The HGI is located near the highway and is convenient for driving to Yountville for dinner or further for the Napa vineyard areas. I recommend a drive on the Silverado Trail and a meal at Auberge du Soile on the terrace. Auberge du Soile is pricey but the food is excellent and the view is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Newer property, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TakesPix
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very rainy Saturday evening after a very long day of traveling. We found the hotel with no problem, although it required paying a lot of attention to where we were going. Once we knew where it was it was easy enough to find subsequently. We checked in and our reservation was in order for a non-smoking king room. The room although on the smallish side was very clean and the furnishings were typical for a Hilton Garden Inn. Included were a minifridge, microwave, and coffee maker. There was a large writing desk with a comfortable executive chair, and Internet access was complimentary. The bed was comfortable with a cozy down alternative duvet. The bathroom contained plenty of toiletries, and the towels were standard hotel quality. The only complaint about the room was the HVAC unit which was quite noisy. Despite what others have said, there was no noise from the street highway, although it might have simply been drowned out by the HVAC unit. The lobby area was comfortable with an inviting fireplace and small wine bar which we didn't visit. In general we found the front desk staff ranging from competent to very friendly and engaging. A highlight each day was the breakfast which was cooked to order with a variety of hot and cold foods offered and exceedingly friendly short-order cooks who got it exactly as requested all three mornings of our stay. We felt that the value received for the price paid was quite good and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff needs work!!!”
Reviews.Author: onenamillion
Reviews.Content: Booking my room was quite a challenge. A front desk clerk I believe she said her name was kendric, was very rude. Because of her I almost did not book the reservation. Once I arrived to my surprise she was working. As it was a vacation I wanted to relax but she had the same attitude checking us in as she did on the phone. I felt very unwelcomed!! Not a good first impression. Once we got past the front desk staff the stay was amazing. The hotel is located just minutes from everything we wanted to do. We had dinner on property one night. Food was excellent. Will definately direct business to this hotel as long as we don't have to deal with that rude, immature, bad representation young girl again.

Reviews.Title: “Served it purpose”
Reviews.Author: mj_chan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as a precursor for a Napa Vally balloon trip (unfortunately cancelled due to weather). Good: Very new, nicely decorated, very clean Internet access works as advertised Adequate parking Neutral: Some noise, but normal for hotel Right next to highway but a little difficult to find Bad: Very small rooms Staff not completely helpfull - Coffee in lobby was cold and staff indicated their was nothing they could do about it until kitchen opened - either not empowered or unwilling

Reviews.Title: “Okay rooms but they cancelled our reservation”
Reviews.Author: THETHREEOFUS2005
Reviews.Content: We missed our connecting flight so we arrived 12 hours late....we called and told them that we wouldn't need the hotel for Thursday night but would be there Friday afternoon....got there and they had booked our room until Saturday. They referred us to a hotel down the street, which turned out to be 10 times better than this hotel (The John Muir Inn). Rooms here are small, just basic rooms. Lobby is nice, but no continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “It was great, but don't pay for breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: Jakey450
Reviews.Content: So I stayed for 8 nights at the Napa HGI, and I can't say that I noticed ANY of the horrible problems the previous reviewers seemed to have had. The front desk staff, ALL of them, were friendly, welcoming and helpful. One member gave me great recommendations for dining, one personally showed me how to fax something on their machine, one helped me print a document, one was happy to arrange a tour for me...it goes on and on. My room was spotless with only a few minor blemishes on the tub in the bathroom (a horrible patch up...but it was clean!) The breakfast was adequate. I say that because in comparison to other HGI's, the breakfast was tiny. Also, there was no buffet style, you asked the cook for service. While I think that's fine, he was quite stingy. NEVER try to get more than two slices of bacon at one time! The waiter at breakfast seemed offended when I mentioned that their breakfast was smaller than other HGI's I've stayed with. They not only offered just one type of juice (most of the other ones have offered 3-4) they didn't offer chocolate milk, a toaster that worked, waffles (even though the machine was in plain view in the kitchen), muffins...but I'll stop being petty. Otherwise, this hotel is almost perfect for the location. Most of the huge Napa wineries are just down the road, a 5 minute drive and you're in the heard of the wine country! There are pleanty of good places to eat in the area (Try Fume' for brunch, it can't be beat).
