Also, just down Solano Ave, the road the hotel is located on, you can find Starbucks, Squeezeburger, companies that will ship wine and the Napa Premium Outlet mall. Ok, another complaint, no hot coffee during the day. Lots of HGI's have coffee pots out for all day self-service...not this one. Anyway, I'd recommend this place...and to the guy that had his wedding ruined...sorry man, but you should always get things in writing.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Garden - Napa Disaster”
Reviews.Author: brando1
Reviews.Content: Well, what should be an enjoyable, remarkable, and wonderful experience...your Wedding! This hotel is a major disappointment in one of the best regions in the world. This hotel doesn't need to be outstanding or 5 star, but it should be consistent, honest, trustworthy, and pleasant. My experience for my wedding guests was a complete disappointment. The hotel recently changed ownership and fired there General Manager-James, who was very good. I booked 30 rooms at the hotel for my wedding guest's during the weekend of June 1st. Instead of the hotel developing a rooming list the right way, I had to book 30 rooms individually in order to honor a $99 rate, via the internet and then manage the rooming list myself. This turned into a nightmare once the wedding was over and the hotel has erroneously charged me over $600 in no-show charges that I'm now having to dispute and involve the Sr. Mgt. at Hilton corporate. The GM that I was working with the whole time of course is no longer with the hotel-remember he was fired. As far as customer service the front desk is horrible, they are inefficient, rude, stand-off'ish, uneducated about the area, and just plain unhelpful. The best person is one of the waiters that works during breakfast. I would guess that he's probably fired by now too. Rooms are standard. Breakfast is overrated. I'd recommend going to Marie Calendar's down the street. Bottom Line - Stay Away From This Hotel at Whatever Cost!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a low class hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyndlutt
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here on a recent trip to the wine country. We stayed at a B&B the nights before. The hotel was what you would expect from a chain. It was clean and had a free small cold breakfast in the mornings. We did have a room that was by some kind of machinery that vibrated and hummed most of the time. This was annoying at times. The service was okay but we did ask for extra pillows the first night and never received them. Overall it was a good deal for Napa. You really are not in your room a lot so it is an okay place to stay. I would suggest trying to stay at a B&B for a couple of nights at least.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: jmontante
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel an extra half point over 3.5 out of 5. It was a nice hotel, our room was very clean. It was actually a little nicer than I had expected after reading the reviews. We had no problems as the poster before me noted. It is very convenient to cruise 29 and visit wineries. The staff was friendly and gave us some good reccomendations. Unfortunately they gave us a room that had an adjoining door to the next room. The sound carried , and we heard them pretty easily. We were gone most of the time at wineries, and dinner etc...so we just let it go and stayed there, I'm sure they would have moved us had we complained.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: SeattleJeremy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was typical for a HGI property - continental breakfast, clean rooms and grounds, business center with printer and rooms were standard. No great pluses or minuses here - meets HGI standards. Remember: HGI are made primarily for business travelers so these aren't hotels that have overly manicured landscapes, theme pools, etc.. so if you're looking for a kid-friendly place with lots of playful extras, you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price, But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: LMC8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in December 2006 and also once before in November 2006. Both times were the same - fairly good customer service - and fairly nice rooms. The previous reviews are pretty accurate. The bathroom doors don't stay open and there is no vent, so you steam up the bathroom completely when you take a shower. The room I had (313) during my second stay was better in terms of the musty smell in the bathroom - it didn't smell at all. I would definitely request a higher floor, away from the elevator (I had 309 previously - the bathroom smelled and you could hear the elevator all night long). One plus is that they have a refrigerator and microwave in every room, which is nice if you travel with people with special diets (like people who keep kosher) and need to bring or purchase their own food. The "wine tasting" that they have in the lobby from 5 to 7pm isn't really a wine tasting - it's more of a cheese and wine (with one white and one red) for the guests - it's free, but once the food runs out, that's it. The location is pretty good - right between the Napa wineries and the Napa town. There is a Target and a Trader Joes across the Highway 29, which is convenient. The Marriott next door looks a lot nicer, but I think more expensive. If you're looking for a fairly good place to stay for a night after a day at the wineries, the Hilton Garden Inn is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a Napa Valley visit.”
Reviews.Author: Seniontraveler
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two evenings at the Hilton Garden, Napa in October 2006. Lobby is beautiful, staff is very helpful, the breakfast (for a fee) was delicious, but there were a couple of troublesome things to take into consideration. We were on the ground floor and could hear every step the people above us were taking. There is no fan in the bathroom and the door closed by itself. We did have a guest laundry right across the fall which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “loving the cookies”
Reviews.Author: Loisstella
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst visitng Napa. It's not the most romantic place to stay in the valley and I guess it's more used for business travel but for a Hitlon, it's quite good. Large room, clean. Very friendly and helpful staff and fresh cookies on the counter. The hotel offers easy access to the vineyards, restaurants and mudbaths in the valley. Good price, nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Good value...”
Reviews.Author: lincolntx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in late July 2006. This was during the heat wave, with 90+ degree days! After reading all the reviews, it was hard to decide where to stay.. I would recommend staying at the Hilton Garden Inn for the PRICE! Save your money for the wineries and food. We chose to drive through the Napa and Sonoma valleys, which was easy to do from the hotel (both on the Silverado Trail and 29.) The hotel is nice...what you expect from a Hilton Garden Inn. The only downside was the wine bar was not open during the week when we were there. I would stay there again, based on the price and the convenience to the highway. The breakfast buffet looked and smelled good each morning. The price was around $10 per person, which we passed on. There was a coffee shop a few minutes away that also served pastries for under $10 total. As far as dining, drive 10 minutes north to Yountville. Mustards Grille was excellent...reservations are recommended. The hotel also recommends a restaurant in Napa...which was excellent! It's the same restaurant that provides their room service....wonderful choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ajhunt2
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the location and the staff. We spent the last half of our honeymoon in Napa. We stayed in one of the king size jacuzzi suites, thanks to upgrading our room. Bed was comfy, room was clean, and the hotel was quite for just being right off the highway. Front desk staff was more that helpful with vineyard and dinner reccomendations. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Deal For The $$$”
Reviews.Author: DaliMama
Reviews.Content: While traveling around the San Francisco Bay area and the Napa wine region this weekend, we stayed at 3 Hilton Garden Inns. I'm a Hilton Honors member and often stay in Hiltons and Doubletrees around the US so I have to admit that I am pretty familiar with the lack of consistency the Hilton brand seems cursed with. The company's savior just might be these Hilton Garden Inns - when traveling on one's own dime, they are definitely a wise choice. We stayed at the Garden Inns located in Cupertino, Napa and Milpitas (ranging in price from $79-$120/night) and were very pleased. The hotels are clean and comfortable. The staff at all 3 locations is very professional, kind and here is a pleasant surprise... the free breakfast is actually very good! I highly recommend these Inns to travelers who are planning to spend the bulk of their time out and about at vacation destination but still want a comfortable, clean and pleasant hotel experience for the $100/night price range.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: noelle1156
Reviews.Content: Just came back in June 2006 from a 2 night stay in the Hilton Garden Inn, Napa valley. I would highly recommend this hotel, Very clean, service was great. The hotel is right off the main highway to all the wineries and near the town of napa. Room were very nice ( ac fan was a little loud, though). From 4- 6, the hotel had complementary wine tasting (one red, and one white) with cheese/ crackers and fruit. The exercise room was OK, though it had no AC. the pool was extremely small and shallow. Overall, it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service for Napa Valley stay”
Reviews.Author: SilverSpringer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend in January 2006. We generally enjoy staying at Hilton Garden Inns with the included breakfast and other facilities such as free internet access, and refrigerators and microwaves in room. This HGI was the nicest we had ever stayed in. The hotel staff was extra friendly, going out of their way to recommend restaurants and wine tastings. The hotel gives you a full cooked to order breakfast instead of the usual continental breakfast. While we were there they offered evening wine and cheese tastings. The location is quiet and very convenient for Napa Valley attractions. The rate for our January stay was very reasonable--we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Chain is OK in Napa”
Reviews.Author: none07
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about staying in a "chain" in the midst of so many quaint inns, B&Bs, etc., but very happy with my choice. The hotel has all of the services you look for (restaurant, small convenience store, parking, pool, in room fridge - very important for picnic goodies - and microwave, high speed internet, etc.). Rooms were spacious and staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: PortAh
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for touring around city of napa. (Prefer this area over to the few others at downtown/first street areas where can get pretty crowded during holidays.) Checkin is quick. Staff is friendly and really accomodative. Had an issue with the initial room being close to the elevator and ice machine. They didnt have one to switch at the time. But couple hours later, a staff pro-actively approached me and said a cancellation made one available, and it even has a jacuzzi in the room. We switch it for the same rate. Sweet deal. The bathroom with jacuzzi is huge for this class, separate shower and separate doored toilet. The jacuzzi has a wooden window that swings out to the room, pretty cool. We love it. Clean, refreshing environment, newly remodelled rooms and enclosed facility. Nice view if the room is facing the soccer field. Great rates too.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So many good points...where to start? The room we had was huge, the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub, a stand up shower, 2 sinks and a seperate toilet closet. The hotel is situated centrally off the main road into the Napa Valley and we easily got to most of the vineyards and restaurants. The staff was great as well. We came home one day from a few (well a lot) of wine tastings and for the lack of a better word, were loaded. They helped us find a pizza place that delivered and called for us without giving us a hard time. My only negative on the place is that there are shutters between the bathroom and the rest of the room which makes the main room a little noisey and bright if someone has to hit the head in the middle of the night. All of that, combined with the price, I found it to be a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here probably 10 times over the last couple of years. Clean, comfortable, very nice staff. Located on the North end of Napa, it's about 10 min from Yountville, 25 min from St. Helena. Centrally located to all the wineries and great restaurants. Compare the prices and it's an AWESOME value. When most of the comparable hotels (including the Marriott next door, which I don't think is nearly as nice) run over $300 in the high season, this one usually tops out at $199. (often 1/2 that in the off-season). Decent breakfast with cook-to-order egg and pancake bar. Because it is a little far south in the Valley, you'll want to plan your daytrips and wine-tasting starting with the Northern-most destinations and work your way south. That way, by the end of a long afternoon of wine-tasting, you're close to your hotel. :-)
